title: REPLICATION_GROUP_USAGE_HISTORY view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs:
The REPLICATION_GROUP_USAGE_HISTORY view in the ORGANIZATION_USAGE schema can be used to query the replication history for
replication and failover groups in your organization within a specified date range. The view includes the name of the
replication or failover group, credits consumed, and bytes transferred for replication.
Name of the organization where the usage took place.
Name of the account where the usage took place.
Name of the region where the account is located.
Date (in the UTC time zone) of this usage record.
Name of the replication or failover group.
Internal/system-generated identifier for the replication or failover group.
Total number of credits used for replication during the USAGE_DATE.
Number of bytes transferred for replication during the USAGE_DATE.
Latency for the view may be up to 24 hours (1 day).
The data is retained for 365 days (1 year).
